context: The word 'nautige' is the imperative form of the verb 'naudia', which means 'to enjoy'. In Estonian, this is a command or suggestion to someone else to enjoy something. For example, 'Nautige hommikust!' means 'Enjoy your morning!'. The verb can be used in different forms depending on the subject and tense - 'nautin' (I enjoy), 'nautid' (you enjoy), etc.
